page.title: 04CHILDRENS SLANG,S.LEEDS
page.content: Everyday on the television we hear people talking.The language they use is correct English.When we are out with our friends we use many words of our own.Here are some of them. {A chuff on}:means somebody is happy {Skit}:means it serves you right {Dosh}:means money {Scran}:means something to eat {Goff}:means to spit {Duffer}:someone who is not very clever {Sprang}:is used if you tell tales about someone. {A Belter}:someone who wears old fashioned clothes {A Dresser}:someone who dresses well. {Knack}:means to hit someone. {Jiggered}:means to be very tired {Cushty}:means something is very good These words are often used by children in our area of South Leeds.
